thread.title: Panasonic Eluga Pure with 5.5-inch display and 8MP selfie camera with flash goes official
thread.title_full: Panasonic Eluga Pure with 5.5-inch display and 8MP selfie camera with flash goes official

title: Panasonic Eluga Pure with 5.5-inch display and 8MP selfie camera with flash goes official
text:
Panasonic Eluga Pure with 5.5-inch display and 8MP selfie camera with flash... Panasonic Eluga Pure with 5.5-inch display and 8MP selfie camera with flash goes official By - March 23, 2017 “The Eluga Pure is a budget offering with 2GB of RAM, 16GB of storage and a 13MP rear camera” 
Panasonic has expanded its range of Eluga series smartphones with the launch of the Eluga Pure in Taiwan. The device sports an 8-megapixel front-facing camera with an LED flash to help you capture better selfies under low light conditions. The entry-level offering boots the dated Android 6.0 Marshmallow with FitHome UI on top. 
The Panasonic Eluga Pure features a 5.5-inch HD display with 2.5D curved glass on top. The phone is powered by a 1.25GHz quad-core MediaTek MT6737 64-bit processor, mated to Mali T720 graphics and 2GB of RAM. The storage capacity on board is 16GB, which can be further increased by inserting a microSD card. 
The Eluga Pure features a 13-megapixel primary shooter at the back with an LED flash. In terms of connectivity, it offers 4G LTE, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.0 and GPS. The phone is fuelled by a 2,900mAh battery. 
The Panasonic Eluga Pure has been priced at NT$ 4,990, roughly Rs 10,700. The phone is available for pre-order in Taiwan in titanium grey hue. There’s no word regarding its launch in India at the moment.
